commitResults.messageTitle: [#667] Report: fix search bar not displaying value provided by url parameter (#676)
commitResults.messageBody:
Search bar component is not displaying the value that is provided 
by the URL parameter.

This confuses users into thinking that only the listed authors and 
repos are all that's captured by the system, when there are others 
which are filtered out.

Let's fix this bug by adding a two-way binding that binds the search 
field and the corresponding JavaScript filterSearch variable.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#695] Report: allow reset of date controls (#700)
commitResults.messageBody:
Pressing the "X" button in the date field only clears the 
date, with no useful functionality.

Users who wish to go back to the default dates will 
need to manually pick the dates from the date picker,
which can be troublesome.

Let's reset the "since date" and "until date" to the earliest and 
latest date respectively, should the user clear the date in the 
respective boxes.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#506] Report: add checks to ensure that .zip file is uploaded (#693)
commitResults.messageBody:
Uploaded files are not checked if the file type is of .zip file.

No alerts will be shown to the user and nothing will happen if they 
were to upload non .zip files to the web page.

Let's check if the uploaded file is .zip file, and show an alert to 
the user if the user uploaded a non .zip file to the web page.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#681,#756] UG: update in accordance to change in Toolbar (#696)
commitResults.messageBody:
The recent changes in the toolbar component of the report view are not 
reflected in the user guide, especially the `group by` function.

When users want to seek the explanation for the `group by`
functionality, they may not understand as the relevant sections in user
guide are outdated.

Let's update the user guide to reflect the changes made to the Toolbar.
Let's also take this chance to rephrase certain descriptions that are
outdated or misleading.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#721] Report: remove usage of spread operator (#766)
commitResults.messageBody:
Microsoft Edge browser does not support spread operator in JavaScript 
ES6.

Users using Microsoft Edge will not be able to load the report.

Let's remove the usage of spread operator so as to allow the report
to be run from Microsoft Edge browser.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#711] Analysis: ignore binary files (#728)
commitResults.messageBody:
Binary files are included in the commits analysis and are shown in the
report view as interpreted plain text.

The produced results are gibberish; junks that do not make sense and
not useful to the readers.

Let's exclude binary files from the analysis.

The method implemented to determine whether a file is binary or not is 
by utilizing "git diff" functionality return a list of committed files 
with the number of lines added and deleted. A file is deemed to be 
binary when the number of lines added and deleted are both "-".

commitResults.messageTitle: [#683,#688] Limit range of commits to one month if "since date" is not specified (#690)
commitResults.messageBody:
"since date", when not specified, defaults to the date of the first
commit. 

Analyzing repos with large number of commits can take up a
long time, which may leave a bad impression for first time users.

Let's,
* limit the range of commits to be captured to one month, if
"since date" is not specified.
* allow `--since *` as a shorthand to specify the date of the first
commit without knowing the actual date.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#781] Fix broken program when reserved character is used without escaping (#782)
commitResults.messageBody:
Following #690, asterisk is used in since date argument as a shorthand
to the date of the first commit.

As asterisk is also a reserved character in shell, using it without
escaping cause the program to be unusable.

Let's change the shorthand to d1 so it can be used directly without the
need to escape.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#567] Report#Zip: remove unrelated files and folders (#656)
commitResults.messageBody:
Zipped files currently contain irrelevant files and/or folders. 

Some users may dump other irrelevant files/folders into 
the same directory as the directory for the repos to be 
cloned into. This results in irrelevant files and folders being 
included in the zip file, which is not intended to be.

Let's zip only the relevant repo folders and the 
corresponding .JSON files into the zip file. 

This method utilizes the existing class `RepoConfiguration` , to
get the list of repos report to be zipped.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#738] CsvParser: fix incorrect splitting of literals commas (#739)
commitResults.messageBody:
We parse CSV by using comma as a delimiter.

When commas are used in a column as value, by enclosing double quotes,
they are mistakenly treated as a delimiter. This results in incorrect
parsing of values.

Let's use third-party CSV parser library, Apache Commons CSV to
handle the intricacies of CSV parsing in a correct and clean
manner.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#531,#707] Analysis: use all formats by default (#708)
commitResults.messageBody:
By default, a set of common programming file formats is used for
analysis. To override the default set, one would need the knowledge of
the file formats used in their repository.

Let's,
* simplify this process by using all file formats present in the
repository by default.
* fix the wrong detection of full directory path instead of filename for
files without file extensions.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#671, #750] CommitInfo: capture commits' message body (#751)
commitResults.messageBody:
In the zoom tab, only the commit titles were listed.

The commit message title alone may be too abstract for users to 
understand the rationale of large implementations.

Let's capture the commit message body as well and store it in
commits report.

This is a backend implementation of capturing message body to aid 
in the implementation of displaying commit message body in the 
zoom tab.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#833] build.gradle: update node.js to 10.16.0 (#836)
commitResults.messageBody:
One of our indirect dependencies, sass@1.22.8, requires
`url.pathToFileURL` which is only available in node.js 10.12.0 or
later.

As our version of node.js is at 10.5.0, this cause our CIs to fail.

Let's update node.js to the latest lts release 10.16.0.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#759] Cloning: remove redundant cloning from remote (#765)
commitResults.messageBody:
In Windows OS, each repo will be bare cloned from the remote, checked 
for any illegal characters in the file path, then cloned from the 
remote again to be analyzed.

The double cloning of the same repo from the remote increases analysis 
time significantly, especially when the user has a sub-optimal
internet bandwidth.

In addition, when setting repo-config file, if the user specifies a
repo branch that contains file path with illegal characters in the repo
to be analyzed first before the other branches of the same repo, an
exception will be thrown for the first branch with files containing
illegal characters in the repo, and the other branches of the same repo
will be ignored.

Let's: -
- Locally clone from the previously cloned bare repo instead to
reduce the overall time of cloning and analysis.
- Check the other branches of the same repo for files containing 
illegal characters as well as analyze them.

Each repo will be bare cloned. Then for each branch to be analyzed, 
the bare repo will be used to check for any illegal characters in the 
file path. If no illegal characters are found, perform a full clone 
from the bare repo into a new location and directly check out into the 
targeted branch to be analyzed.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#745] Toolbar: edit flexbox properties (#768)
commitResults.messageBody:
The toolbar does not adjust to changes in window or pane width.

Under certain widths, the `search` field is not visible.

Let's edit the flexbox properties of the toolbar to allow its elements
to shrink and wrap to occupy more rows when the window or pane width 
is decreased.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#705] Log: distinct warning and error messages (#794)
commitResults.messageBody:
Messages of different severity are outputed in similar format, without
any form of distinction.

This creates difficulty for our users to distinguish messages of
different severity from the logs. Moreover, messages of higher severity
often contains important info which may requires user's action and
shouldn't be left unnoticed.

Let's make these messages more distinct by inserting a highlighted
status tag e.g. `[ERROR]` before the message.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#753] Display individuals' contribution (#762)
commitResults.messageBody:
Contribution is shown only for each group as a whole.

While it is possible to view the contribution based on each chart by 
hovering over the contribution bar, this requires extra work by the
user. It will be more user-friendly if the contribution can be viewed
on the page itself.

Let's display the contribution for each chart in the chart title.
This information is shown using the same style as the group's total 
contribution.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#661] Change chart title format (#802)
commitResults.messageBody:
The chart title uses underscores to separate `org`, `repo` and
`branch`. Furthermore, `displayName` is used for both the chart title
and repo analysis output folder name.

`org`, `repo` and `branch` might have underscores in them, making it
difficult to discern each term. Using a single parameter displayName
to represent both the output folder name and the chart title would
constrain us to not use /. This has shown that the output folder name
and the chart title have little compatibility, and difficulty in coming
up with a coherent format.

Let's use a separate variable, `outputFolderName`, for the out folder
name so that a different format, `org/repo[branch]`, can be used for
the chart title.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#652] ChartView: fix url directing to wrong repository (#655)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Octocat icon links to a GitHub repository by using the index 0 to
get the URL of the first repository.

When summary charts are grouped by Author, different repositories 
under the same Author to all link to the same URL as the first 
repository.

Let's update the URL to point to their respective repository by
referencing with the correct index.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#672] Toolbar: set 'commit' as default for granularity (#684)
commitResults.messageBody:
The default value of granularity is `Day`.

`Commit` as granularity is more closer to reality because users are more
likely to observe per commits rather than per day/week. Users can choose
a more summarized view at their discretion.

Let's change the default value for granularity to `Commit`.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#699] Report: standardize the author's name display (#701)
commitResults.messageBody:
When summary charts are grouped by none or repo/branch, author's name
display shows only the display name. Whereas when grouped by author,
the name display shows the display name as well as GitHub username.

This causes inconsistency in the name display. Furthermore, user won't
be able to refer to the author's GitHub username when the summary
charts are not grouped by author.

Let's standardize all the name display using the format,
[display name] (github username).

commitResults.messageTitle: [#635] CodeView: add line number to code (#669)
commitResults.messageBody:
The code view displays only the code without the line number.

It is hard to associate a specific line from the code view with the
actual code without the line number.

Let's update the code view to display the line numbers by adding an
array in each segment to keep track of the line numbers of the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#702] Fix url directing to the wrong branch (#704)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Octocat icon always links to the master branch of a GitHub 
repository.

Octocat icons of summary charts that are not within the master 
branch will still point to the URL of the master branch.

Let's update the URL to point to their respective branch.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#664] Toolbar: expand width for `breakdown by file format` (#685)
commitResults.messageBody:
The width of label `breakdown by fileformat` is set to 110px which
displays in two lines even though there are enough room for it to
display in a single line.

This will cause the label to not look as organised as compared to the
label being displayed in a single line.

Let's expand the width for `breakdown by file format` by setting the
width as fit-content to ensure that the label is displayed in a single
line.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#663] ChartView: add total contribution of group (#697)
commitResults.messageBody:
A group only shows the total contribution of each author or repo/branch
within the group but not the total contribution of all combined.

It is rather difficult for the user to compare the total contribution
between groups as the user would need to sum up the contribution of each
row in order to get the total contribution of a group.

Let's display the total contribution of groups beside the group title so
that it is easier for the user to do comparisons between groups.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#647] Toolbar: rename values in `sort group by` (#668)
commitResults.messageBody:
The `sort groups by` selection contains the option of `repo/branch` and
`name` when charts are grouped by Repo/Branch and Author respectively.

As it is a `sort group by` selection, there's is no need to use two
different options `repo/branch` and `name` as they both refer to the
`group name`

Let's rename both values to `group name` to standardize the values.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#660] ChartView: remove ramp slices not within date range (#670)
commitResults.messageBody:
After adjusting the date range, ramp slices that are not within the 
date range still shows in the ramp row.

Users would only want to see the ramp slices that are within the date 
range.

Let's remove the ramp slices that are not within date range by 
checking if the position of the ramp slices are within the width of 
the ramp row (if it is not within the width of the ramp row, the ramp
slice is not within date range) before adding the ramp slices to the 
ramp row.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#712] ChartView: fix misalignment of chart title (#715)
commitResults.messageBody:
When 'breakdown by file format' is checked, the title of a chart aligns
beside the contribution bars of the previous chart when the
contribution bars' height of exceeds the margin allocated.

Let's fix this misalignment by adding css property 'clear:left' to the
chart title so that the chart title will always start at a new line.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#689] v_summary.js: remove unused remnants code (#733)
commitResults.messageBody:
Unused code was found in v_summary.js; specifically code associated
with the variable, filterSortReverse. They are remnants left behind by
the improvement of sort controls introduced in #618.

The unused code was originally bind to the reverse checkbox in the
older version of RepoSense. As the checkbox was replaced by the
introduction of ascending and descending options in #618, the code is
now unused and redundant. This is also partially due to the complexity
brought upon by new sorting group, the reversing has to be done within
the code of descending's logic, rendering those code not reusable.

Let's remove the unused code associated to the variable, 
filterSortReverse and it's implementations.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#645] CodeView: improve UI of sort bar (#716)
commitResults.messageBody:
In the UI of sortbar: 
- The font size of 3 controls (searchbar, checkbox, sort) are different
- The sorting option's position is below the radio controls
- The font of reverse checkbox is red in colour
- The gaps between sorting option and radio controls is not 
standardized

Lets:
- Standardize the font size of all 3 controls so that the sort bar
looks neater
- Shift sorting option to be above radio controls to further
emphasize the number of radio buttons better
- Set the font of reverse checkbox to be black in color to
differentiate from other checkboxes and to be consistent with the
ChartView
- Standardize the gaps between sorting option and radio controls

commitResults.messageTitle: [#720] Set command-click to activate zoom-in feature for macOS devices (#730)
commitResults.messageBody:
Ctrl + mouse left-click is the default combination to activate the
zoom-in feature for all environment.

However, as the combination is registered as a right-click in macOS
environment, users of macOS devices wouldn't be able to activate the
corresponding feature.

Let's modify the zoom-in controls to allow command click for macOS 
devices and control click for all other devices.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#666] CodeView: load un-authored code only when toggled (#740)
commitResults.messageBody:
Viewing the changes in code of an author causes the app to 
render all authored and un-authored segments within modified files.
A small change in large file will cause the entire file to be preloaded.

When an author has small changes done to a lot of large files, it will
lead to an unresponsive page as loading the large un-authored segments
will affect the rendering speed. Furthermore, the preloading of all 
un-authored code is not necessary as users might only view the 
un-authored code under certain circumstances. (e.g. when the user 
does not understand why the author added the authored code)

Let's modify the app to only load the un-authored code when the 
user toggles the 'Show untouched code' icon.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#741] Fix view code icon not opening CodeView (#744)
commitResults.messageBody:
The splitCommitsWeek() method executes a dateRounding() method that 
rounds up the filterSinceDate to the next nearest Monday. When the 
report page is reloaded, the filterSinceDate is set to the value of 
the 'since' hash by the getDates() method. Since within the 
getFiltered() method, splitCommitsWeek() is executed before
getDates(), the filterSinceDate stores an empty string which is 
passed to the dateRounding() method and returns a NaN value. 

Since splitCommitsWeek() method is only called when granularity is 
'week', if users were to set granularity as 'week' and reload the page,
clicking on the view code icon does not open the CodeView panel. 

Let's shift the getDates() method to be executed before 
splitCommitsWeek() to make sure that splitCommitWeek() method
is called with a valid filterSinceDate, which fixes the described bug.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#680] Vue: fix error message in development mode (#742)
commitResults.messageBody:
An error message stating "error compiling template: - <template>
cannot be keyed. Place the key on real elements instead." was found in
Chrome browser's console when running Vue in development mode for our
report.

Although the Vue development tool still functions correctly, it 
highlights an issue with the existing style and possibility degrades 
the efficiency of the operations.

Let's remove the Chrome browser console error by shifting the binding 
of keys from the <template> tag to the inner <label> tag.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#770] Add placeholder for repositories with no author found (#777)
commitResults.messageBody:
Repositories with no author specified in the configuration files as
well as no commits made during the specified period do not appear in
the report.

This is caused by a TypeError in JavaScript. When an author
configuration can't be found for a repository, RepoSense will perform
the identification of the authors using the commits. However, in the
event that even commits cannot be found, author information will not be
available and result in the error stated above.

As users may not notice the disappearance of these repositories, let's
add a placeholder with an error message of 'NO AUTHOR WITH COMMITS
FOUND WITHIN THIS PERIOD OF TIME' to the affected repositories to
inform users of the occurrence of this error.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#312] CodeView: reduce space taken by toggle icon (#773)
commitResults.messageBody:
The toggle icon that separates between untouched and touched code 
segments within the CodeView takes up significant amount of extra space.

The extra white space causes the code to be in a different layout than 
its actual layout.

Let's place the toggle icon on the side of the code to not disrupt the 
layout of the code while saving the extra space taken by the current
toggle icon.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#748] Restore authorship tab (#749)
commitResults.messageBody:
Reloading the report page with the authorship tab opened will result
to a closed authorship tab.

The info.name property is only created when clicking on the view code
icon and calling openTabAuthorship() method of v_summary. The
initiate() method of v_authorship sets the isTabActive property to be 
false if info.name property does not exist. Reloading the report page 
does not call openTabAuthorship(), which means that the info.name 
property will not exist and the isTabActive is false regardless of 
url value.

Let's modify the initiate() method of v_authorship.js to check for
info.author property instead of info.name as the property exists 
when reloading the page as well as clicking on the view code icon.
This modification properly restores the last viewed authorship tab, 
if any.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#791] CodeView: bugfix for unexpected colors in line numbers (#792)
commitResults.messageBody:
The css property of line number only overwrites the color property of 
classes 'hljs-number' and 'hljs-comment'. Others classes such as
'hljs-quote', 'hljs-name' and more are not overwritten.

This will cause the color property of certain line numbers to inherit 
from the hljs classes that are not overwritten.

Let's overwrite all hljs classes to ensure the color property of the 
line number to always be grey.

commitResults.messageTitle: ChartView: highlight error messages in red (#790)
commitResults.messageBody:
Within ChartView, ramp charts with error messages are blended together 
with the other ramp charts without error messages as they both have 
similar UI.

Let's modify the UI of ramp charts with error messages to use red color 
for their info message font to distinguish itself from other ramp 
charts without error messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#811] CodeView: fix position of toggle icons (#813)
commitResults.messageBody:
The 'closer' class designated for icons that toggle code segments
is absolutely positioned. Due its parent class, 'untouched', being 
in default static position, 'closer' is positioned relatively to the 
edges of the root containing block.

When scrolling through horizontally within each code segment, the 
toggle icons remains unchanged in their position in x-axis, hovering 
over the text in code view.

Let's relatively position the 'untouched' class, which turns the class 
into a containing block. This ensures absolutely positioned elements 
contained within will be positioned relative to the edges of 'untouched'
rather than the root containing block.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#522] Implement style checker on .scss files (#803)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense currently has CheckStyle and ESLint to check our java and 
javascript code styles automatically. However, .scss files are not 
covered by any of these tools.

Let's implement stylelint to check the code styles of .scss files.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#764] Toolbar: fix search functionality for Safari users (#797)
commitResults.messageBody:
The 'enter' key submits html forms in browsers such as Chrome and 
Firefox, but not in Safari.

Since the getFiltered() method is executed on submit of the html form,
Safari browser users are unable to activate the search functionality 
when search value is keyed in and 'enter' key is pressed.

Let's move the execution of getFiltered() method to be within 
updateFilterSearch(), to ensure that Safari users are also able to 
activate the search functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#763] v_summary.js: remove redundant calls to getFiltered() (#800)
commitResults.messageBody:
When reloading the report page, the data in v_summary such as
filterSinceDate, filterUntilDate, filterTimeFrame etc will change based 
on the URL hash values. The changes in data will trigger the watchers 
for those data, and each of them will call getFiltered() method.

Only one call for getFiltered() is required after rendering the filter 
hash, the other getFiltered() calls by the watchers are redundant.
When the report is large in size, repeatedly executing getFiltered()
when reloading the report will also significantly affect the loading 
performance of our report.

Let's only allow watchers to execute getFiltered() after the first 
cycle of watcher updates to prevent redundant calls to getFiltered().

commitResults.messageTitle: [#724] Modify zoom-in feature to based on selected granularity (#729)
commitResults.messageBody:
The zoom-in feature opens the zoom panel to show the selected
sub-range of a ramp chart in terms of 'commit'. This feature, however, 
only works when the granularity is set to commit or day.

Users will not be able to use this feature with granularity set to week,
as the method getUserCommits() gets all user commits by interating 
through an undefined key object 'dayCommits', which stops the method
execution.

Moreover, long sub-range of ramp charts will contain dense information 
with ramp slices overlapping each other. This happens even when 
granularity is set to day or week, which makes it difficult for users to 
notice substantial info on these ramp charts.

Let's correctly implement the zoom-in feature when granularity is set to
week. Furthermore, let's modify the feature for the ramp chart within 
zoom panel to be in terms of the granularity selected, which allow users 
to observe selected granularity of commits more clearly within the 
zoomed-in range.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#780] v_summary.js: remove Vue watcher for repos (#783)
commitResults.messageBody:
A redundant Vue watcher was found in v_summary.js, specifically the Vue
watcher for repos, as repos should remain constant and not be modified.

This is primarily used to call the getUsers() method, however this 
itself is redundant as getUsers() shouldn't be called more than once 
as it tends to overwrite repos with the same set of values.

Additionally, using Vue watcher for large data, such as repos, affects 
the performance of the report.

Let's remove the Vue watcher for repos and modify getUsers() to be 
called only once when page is firstly loaded.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#820] Cypress: add sinceDate in command arguments (#821)
commitResults.messageBody:
The arguments used to generate the sample report used in Cypress 
tests is '--repo https://github.com/reposense/RepoSense.git --view'. 

Since sinceDate and untilDate is not provided in the arguments, the 
report duration will be from one month before today's date until
today's date. This causes the current sample report used for Cypress
tests to contain empty ramp charts, which does not mimic a realistic
report.

Let's add a '--since d1' argument to the existing arguments, which 
generates a more realistic sample report that contains the commits
made from start until today's date.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#828] Revert "v_summary.js: remove redundant calls to getFiltered() (#800)" (#832)
commitResults.messageBody:
PR #800 was intended to ensure the getFiltered() method to be executed 
only once when the page is reloaded. The solution used was to set 
boolean canGetFiltered to true in beforeUpdate() lifecycle hook, 
preventing the execution of getFiltered() before the lifecycle hook.
However, the beforeUpdate() lifecycle hook will only be executed when 
there are changes to the DOM. 

Instances where the page is reloaded and there are no changes to the DOM
will not set boolean canGetFiltered to true, preventing getFiltered() to 
be executed until the DOM has changed.

Let's revert PR #800 to allow getFiltered() to be executed even when 
there are no changes to the DOM.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#809] DeveloperGuide: update the HTML report section (#810)
commitResults.messageBody:
The HTML report section in our DG contains outdated info such as the
report summary diagram, sequence diagrams and the list of js files.

Let's perform promptly due update, revise the HTML report section with
the latest report summary diagram, Vue lifecycle diagram, sequence
diagrams and the descriptions of the recently added js files such as
v_ramp, v_zoom, and v_segment.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#723] Report: fix modifying dates for Safari users (#801)
commitResults.messageBody:
Safari browser users are unable to modify sinceDate and untilDate in
the report.

This is due to the datepickers used are HTML5 elements; they are not
supported by Safari. Furthermore, the alternative to modify the date
fields, through the keydown events, are disabled.

Let's allow Safari browser users to use a text-type input for their
sinceDate and untilDate inputs. They can modify the dates by
keying the numeric date values into the date fields followed by hitting
the key, `enter`.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#778] ChartView: add zoom tab button (#796)
commitResults.messageBody:
In addition to zooming into a range of ramp slices, the zoom tab also
shows the breakdown of commits that are within the zoom range. This 
functionality however, is not encompassed for the entire ramp chart.

Let's add a button that opens the zoom tab for the entire ramp chart.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#662] ChartView: add merge group option (#752)
commitResults.messageBody:
Within ChartView, a group has multiple rows of ramp charts that belongs
to the group itself.

It may be difficult for users to analyse the contribution of the entire
group or to compare the contribution between groups.

Let's add a merge group checkbox such that when the checkbox is
checked, all ramp charts of the same group will be merged together
to form a single ramp chart. This allows users to easily analyse 
the total contribution on the group level.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#846] CodeView: fix show ramps for this period button (#847)
commitResults.messageBody:
Clicking on show ramp chart for this period button in the commits
panel calls updateDateRange(), which recomputes the duration of the
ramp chart according to the drags by the user. The method proceeds 
to call deactivateAllOverlays(), which removes the drags by the user.

Since no more drags are left after the first execution of 
updateDateRange(), clicking on the show ramp chart for this period
button will not be able to activate updateDateRange().

Let's use the zoom since date and until date to recompute the duration
of the ramp chart, instead of using the drags. This will ensure that
clicking on the button will always show the ramp chart for the 
designated period.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#839] Set config to be inclusive of until date (#840)
commitResults.messageBody:
The until date in the config does not match with the until date used in
git rev-list. Until date in the config is in 00:00:00 time whereas
until date used in git rev-list uses the time 23:59:59 of the day
before.

This discrepancy can cause the content and author of each line detected
by git rev-list to be different, and have caused a disparity in the
output results in #789.

Let's standardise the until date in the config to use time of 23:59:59 
to match with the until date used in git rev-list.

Reference:
https://github.com/reposense/RepoSense/pull/789#discussion_r307350220

commitResults.messageTitle: [#754] Url: include date hashes only when modified (#757)
commitResults.messageBody:
The initial URL of the report page captures a start and until 
hash parameter even when the users did not specify the start date
and end date fields in the CLI.

The URL is then shared to others. If there are further updates to the 
report, the URL will still navigate to the report page with ramps up 
until the original start date and until date instead of the most
updated dates which may include more recent/older commits.

Let’s modify the report’s initial URL to not capture the start and end 
date hashes when users did not specify the respective date field in
the CLI. Without the start date or end date hash parameter in the URL,
the URL will navigate to the report with the most updated start date
and end date.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#842] Fix out of bound ramp slices (#844)
commitResults.messageBody:
Ramp slices appear outside of the ramp charts in week granularity.

This is due to the implementation of splitCommitsWeek() does not take
into account when the duration between since date and until date is
less than one week. When the duration is less than a week, the
algorithm calculates commits up to the following Monday, even if they
are beyond the until date. Hence, it causes a distortion in the ui.

Let's revamp the logic within splitCommitsWeek to check, and trim any
commits beyond the until date.
